description: From Latin speculātor (“spy, explorer, investigator”), from speculor (“to watch, to observe”) +‎ -tor (“-er: forming agent nouns”), from specula (“watchtower”), from speciō (“to watch, to observe”), q.v. In some senses, an agent noun formed within English from speculate. Doublet of spectator.

entries.meaning: One who speculates; an observer; a contemplator.
One who forms theories; a theorist.
(business, finance) One who speculates; as in investing, one who is willing to take volatile risks upon invested principal for the potential of substantial returns.
